foy.title: Foy – Tactical Map Briefing
foy.terrain: Snowy terrain with sparse forests, open fields, and destructible buildings. Sightlines are long and armor-friendly.
foy.points: Key strongpoints include WN7, Foy center, Train Station, and West Bend. Midpoints are mostly exposed.
foy.infantry: Use trees and hedgerows for cover. Avoid crossing open fields unless smoked. Control houses in Foy and Train Station.
foy.armor: Use long sightlines to lock down roads and choke points. Coordinate with infantry to push the center.

omaha.title: Omaha Beach – Tactical Map Briefing
omaha.terrain: Steep beach ascent with trenches, bunkers, and narrow chokepoints. Lots of verticality.
omaha.points: Strongpoints include Dog Green, WN73, and The Ruins. The beach is vulnerable to spawn camping.
omaha.infantry: Smoke the beachhead. Use bunkers and trench lines to flank. Push past chokepoints quickly.
omaha.armor: Stay off the beach unless supported. Use tanks to suppress bunkers and overwatch cliffs.

utah.title: Utah Beach – Tactical Map Briefing
utah.terrain: Wide open beach zones with dense hedgerow inland. Few hard structures.
utah.points: Look for control of The Bluffs, WN5, and The Orchard. Inland movement becomes more infantry-focused.
utah.infantry: Clear trench lines and push inland fast. Build garrisons in barns and behind hedgerows.
utah.armor: Support landings from distance. Inland, tanks must stay on roads or risk traps in fields.

stalingrad.title: Stalingrad – Tactical Map Briefing
stalingrad.terrain: Urban rubble with tight alleys, bombed-out buildings, and collapsed infrastructure.
stalingrad.points: Factory District, Railroad Depot, and Red October are the bloodiest choke points.
stalingrad.infantry: Stay off rooftops. Clear buildings room by room. Use smoke to cross major streets.
stalingrad.armor: Risky to deploy armor in city center. Protect tanks with infantry cover or avoid the middle.

kursk.title: Kursk – Tactical Map Briefing
kursk.terrain: Flat and open. Rolling hills with minimal cover. Sniper and armor paradise.
kursk.points: Windmill, Tank Traps, and North Farm are all long-range fights. Garrisons are hard to hide.
kursk.infantry: Stick to trenches and terrain dips. Move in teams and avoid open ground.
kursk.armor: Kursk is armor-heavy. Control the ridge lines and snipe enemy tanks before they move.

carentan.title: Carentan – Tactical Map Briefing
carentan.terrain: Mixed city and farmland. Tight roads, canals, and plenty of fences.
carentan.points: Main intersections: Cemetery, Train Station, and Church Square. Close quarters fights.
carentan.infantry: Use canals and back alleys to flank. Smoke is key to crossing open streets.
carentan.armor: Hold long streets and intersections. Tanks can dominate, but risk satchels in tight areas.

sme.title: Sainte-Mère-Église – Tactical Map Briefing
sme.terrain: Classic bocage country. Dense hedgerows and tight fields dominate the map.
sme.points: Strongpoints include Church, Cemetery, and Flak Gun positions.
sme.infantry: Hedgerows are your best cover. Watch for ambushes at every corner.
sme.armor: Stick to roads. Fields are dangerous and can trap you in.

hill400.title: Hill 400 – Tactical Map Briefing
hill400.terrain: Forested hilltop combat. Fog, elevation, and tree cover everywhere.
hill400.points: Hilltop, Forest Cut, and Logging Camp are brutal midpoints.
hill400.infantry: Move tree-to-tree. Avoid the hilltop crest unless smoked.
hill400.armor: Stay low and use wooded trails. You'll be exposed at elevation.

remagen.title: Remagen – Tactical Map Briefing
remagen.terrain: Bridge combat. Urban on one side, open on the other. The river splits the map.
remagen.points: Bridge Center, Train Yard, and Riverside Outpost are critical zones.
remagen.infantry: Cross the bridge carefully. Use catwalks, ladders, and lower crossings.
remagen.armor: Hold one end of the bridge. Crossing exposes you — wait for smoke cover.

elalamein.title: El Alamein – Tactical Map Briefing
elalamein.terrain: Open desert. Massive dunes, scattered structures, minimal cover.
elalamein.points: Key zones include Fortress Ruins, Outpost, and Supply Depot.
elalamein.infantry: Stay behind dunes. Dig in with nodes and supplies.
elalamein.armor: Wide open tank combat. Control the high dunes and flank across dry valleys.

kharkov.title: Kharkov – Tactical Map Briefing
kharkov.terrain: Winter wasteland with forests, hills, and frozen rivers.
kharkov.points: Key zones: Village Center, Sawmill, and Crossing Point.
kharkov.infantry: Stay in the woods. Use white camo. Watch for tanks crossing rivers.
kharkov.armor: Use tree lines for cover fire. Rotate after each push or risk flanks.

hurtgen.title: Hürtgen Forest – Tactical Map Briefing
hurtgen.terrain: Tight forest combat. Low visibility, minimal roads, constant ambushes.
hurtgen.points: Bunker Hill, Logging Site, and West Woods dominate the fight.
hurtgen.infantry: Ambush and traps rule here. Stay close to your squad.
hurtgen.armor: Limited armor value. Avoid deep woods and rotate out fast.

phl.title: Purple Heart Lane – Tactical Map Briefing
phl.terrain: Flooded farmlands with trenches, canals, and bridges.
phl.points: Bridge Crossing, Estate, and Canal Bunker are key.
phl.infantry: Use trenches and fences. Smoke the canal crossing.
phl.armor: Use main roads. Avoid deep water crossings.

smdmv2.title: Saint-Marie-du-Mont V2 – Tactical Map Briefing
smdmv2.terrain: Bocage, barns, and wide open farms. Classic rural HLL feel.
smdmv2.infantry: Clear structures before advancing. Watch for tanks hiding in treelines.
smdmv2.armor: Use roads and fence lines. Push with infantry to cap points.

driel.title: Driel – Tactical Map Briefing
driel.terrain: Floodplain farmland with river crossings and bridges.
driel.points: Crossroads, Canal Farm, and Wheat Mill.
driel.infantry: Push over dikes carefully. Use bridges and smoke to advance.
driel.armor: Anchor from paved roads. Avoid low spots with no exit.

elsenborn.title: Elsenborn Ridge – Tactical Map Briefing
elsenborn.terrain: Winter ridge map with frozen fields, trenches, and roads.
elsenborn.points: Radar Station, Ridge Bunker, and Ammo Dump.
elsenborn.infantry: Stay in trenches. Push ridge lines carefully. Smoke is critical.
elsenborn.armor: Control the ridge crest with Panthers or Shermans.

mortain.title: Mortain – Tactical Map Briefing
mortain.terrain: Valleys, elevation, and rural French villages.
mortain.points: Church Hill, Grain Silo, and South Fields.
mortain.infantry: Hold hills with machine guns. Build behind hedgerows.
mortain.armor: Use elevation advantage. Tanks can lock down the fields.

tobruk.title: Tobruk – Tactical Map Briefing
tobruk.terrain: Open desert with fortifications and tunnels.
tobruk.points: Fort Line, Oasis, and Anti-Tank Ditch.
tobruk.infantry: Use trenches. Avoid cresting dunes without cover.
tobruk.armor: Desert warfare. Tanks rule if positioned properly.
